post.body:
Docker is really great piece of technology.
 `docker run -d -e "ENABLE_TOR=true" --name "zeronet-tor" -v /home/user/.local/share/zeronet-data/:/root/data -p 15441:15441 -p 127.0.0.1:43110:43110 nofish/zeronet:latest ` 
and you have Zeronet node in the container with working Tor. No dependencies, no fuss.

So Dat, Beaker and Rotonde are getting some attention now: https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=15463721 
What do you think about it? Dat seems to be nice project. It's written in js so it can be easily embedded. 
Btw: here is my Rotonde link:
dat://4c8bb42720a04d3d207f9fdfc763827a74c1b59a447c35334401b01c0c0d4fca/
Wow, ZeroMedium looks like yet another amazing service! ZeroMedium.bit

Kakoune is pretty awesome modal text editor. It's better than Vim IMHO. Check it out
https://github.com/mawww/kakoune/blob/master/contrib/TRAMPOLINE
Firefox 57 is fucking RAD! If you like FOSS then check it out :D
I'm testing if my website https://www.teddydd.me/ would work on zeronet 1MPvDnANeG2neQV5WfqCDxZprzWqkGzQXE/ Some images does not work.

comment.body: @caryoscelus: Kakoune is basically public domain, but It does not mean contributor have less rights than anybody else. Public domain is cool but in some countries it requires explicit copyright disclaimer. That's why Creative Commons Zero exists.
@caryoscelus: pleas read "Unlicensing Contributions" paragraph here https://unlicense.org/

@caryoscelus: it's worded this way to prevent any contributor from **shutting down** project in the future using copyright claim or DMCA. As you said "Basically you can't claim copyright for any commits you make unless you forked the code" and that's true. That's whole point of Public Domain right? You can fork PD project and claim it as yours, but you can't shut down original Kakoune repo.

@caryoscelus: It's law, It depends on interpretation but according to Github "Unlicensed works, modifications, and larger works may be distributed under **different terms** and without source code." So you can fork and change license to anything you want.  You just can't take down Kakoune repo or any fork with DMCA. According to Wikipedia "a program is automatically subject to a copyright, and if it is to be placed in the public domain, the author must explicitly disclaim the copyright and other rights on it in some way, e.g. by a waiver statement"

@caryoscelus: That would make no sense and I belive it does not work that way. It's like special case of CLA where you agree to release your patches as PD. Damn I had no idea that Unlicense can cause that much confusion. Maybe they should consider switching to CC-0? I doubt it would help though. PD in software is hard - it's actually easier to just use MIT/ISC license than release software on PD.
@Binchan: yup, I'v got images in static/images. I can click links and image shows up. Weird. I'll dig into it later
@Binchan: That would require changes in my Hugo config, I try to figure it out.
